data.title: 'Builder function' might not be necessery
data.body:
Refs #15873

All the docs for methods for `SnippetString` start with 'Builder function'. As a user while I am quickly browsing through intelisense I want to quickly find out what each method does. Since each method has the same prefix 'Builder function' the process of finding out the purpose of each method is harder than needed.

'Builder function' is also not used anywhere else in our API.

Consider removing this from the docs, or at least do not put it at the very start of each method description.

data.title: Search viewlet progress bar never completes
data.body:
Testing #16416

I tried to stress test the search service and come up with as ugly regexes as I can produce :). While typing I would hit Enter from time to time to stress it even more. I got in the following state (I saw the 4 workers going down, but the UI progress bar continued to move until at one point it is just stuck and the workers shut down in the meantime):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/20927923/e3d40aa8-bbc3-11e6-8a77-aefc2062d99e.png)

data.title: Why two SnippetString appendVariable methods
data.body:
Refs #15873

Why do we have two appendVariable method in SnippetString. Could we not merge them into one that would have a defaultValue as an optional paramter?

The downside of the current approach is that quite some documentation is duplicated.

data.title: 'surround selection with quotes' deletes last character on Mac / US Int. Layout

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan 10.11.6
- Keyboard: layout: US International

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set the keyboard layout to US International 
2. Select any range in any editor.
3. Type single or double quotes " ' (once)
4. Finish the operation with any of [second quote | Esc | mouse click]

Symptom: Though the text wrapping operation works, a third quote will replace the last character of the selection.

data.title: Chinese: , and . ignored
data.body:
Refs #16547

IE11, monaco editor, turn on simplifed chinesse Type . or , in full width form. They are not typed in immediatly, they are ignored. 

Which conflicts with what is expected https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/IME-Test#windows-chinese

data.title: Breakpoints context menu
data.body:
Testing #16013 

IMHO:
* context menu actions should be grouped in two sections: ones that contains actions applying to the current breakpoint and one that contains "global" actions
* it would be nice if the label "Enable/Disable breakpoint" would reflect the state of the current breakpoint
* it would be nice if some of the duplicated "global" actions could be removed.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/20926670/eba0d99c-bbbd-11e6-985d-56fb638b4447.png)

data.title: Searched words appear underneath the searchbox
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Window 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a page of editor filled with text
2. Search for words at the top of the editor using Ctrl + F, now the word you've search is underneath the searchbox which is really annoying

data.title: Cannot expand complex objects printed through console.log
data.body:
Testing #15901

I cannot interact with printed objects as advertised in #15901

nodejs `process.versions`: 
```
ares:"1.10.1-DEV"
http_parser:"2.7.0"
icu:"57.1"
modules:"48"
node:"6.9.1"
openssl:"1.0.2j"
uv:"1.9.1"
v8:"5.1.281.84"
zlib:"1.2.8"
```

### main.js
```js


var a, b, c, d, e, f;

a = '5';
b = 123;
c = 321;
d = 'a very long string';
e = null;
f = [ 123, 231, 312];

console.log({
    asd1: 'asd',
    asd2: 'asd',
    asd3: 'asd',
    asd4: 'asd',
    asd5: 'asd',
    asd6: 'asd',
    asd7: 'asd',
    asd8: 'asd',
    asd9: 'asd',
    asd10: 'asd',
    asd11: 'asd',
    asd12: 'asd',
    asd13: 'asd'
})

console.log(console);

console.log(a, b, c, d, e, f);
```

### launch.json
```json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "type": "node2",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/main.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        },
        {
            "name": "Attach to Process",
            "type": "node2",
            "request": "attach",
            "port": 9229
        }
    ]
}
```
breakpoint on last `console.log` statement.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/20924641/e1500982-bbb2-11e6-8f4c-9cfc78e9a040.png)

data.title: keymaps are confusing to configure
data.body: IMO  keymaps are similar to themes and icon themes. You get them from the marketplace, can install many, but only one is active at a time. For themes and icon themes we have an aligned story which goes in two steps (1) install extension, (2) enable theme. For keymaps we chose a different approach and I don't understand why? Also, the message to disable other extensions that happen to have set the `Keycaps`-category is easy to dismiss leaving me without an explicit action to configure the active keymap-extension.

data.title: Excessive find-replace in debugViewlet.ts
data.body:
```ts
container.textContent = value.replace(/\n/g, '\\n').replace(/\r/g, '\\r').replace(/\t/g, '\\t');
```

Why is [this line](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugViewer.ts#L79) there? Those `replace` calls don't do anything, right?

data.title: Content inside style attributes should have same coloring as css style elements
data.body:
Refs #16526

Notice how the css attributes have different coloring if they are inside the style element or inside the style attributes. Ideally the coloring would be the same

![screen shot 2016-12-06 at 12 24 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/20923929/17be2408-bbaf-11e6-8b2c-c4c52814dcfb.png)

data.title: html.format.unformatted does not respect scripts
data.body:
Refs #16526

1. Have a html file with scripts tag
2. Add a scripts tag to the html.format.unformatted
3. Format the document - notice the content inside scripts tag still gets formated

data.title: Sublime: 'transpose' behaviour difference
data.body:
while testing #16545:

VS Code's 'transpose' command doesn't work at end of the line. This behaviour differs from Sublime.

data.title: Debug widget broken when stopping debug while attaching to another
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. debug a node.js app 
2. start another debug session by attaching to some port that is not opened
3. while that is running stop debugging

=> the debug widget looks weird

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20923690/023ca5f6-bbae-11e6-854f-e6cb7961a7b4.png)

data.title: [html] HTML, script type=langid should properly tokenize any mode

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
Testing #16526

We used to be able to tokenize any mode inside a `script` tag, as long as the user provided the correct `type` attribute.

data.title: EventHandlers content should have js coloring

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs #16526 

Event handler values should have javascript coloring. Currently it is colored as a string but all the js funcitonality is there. As a user would not expect this to work due to string coloring - thus it will be hard to find the nice intelli-sense support you have there

![screen shot 2016-12-06 at 12 14 35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/20923644/b7e5de78-bbad-11e6-91f8-6ecdc52faa57.png)

data.title: Selection menu: Not all actions work on read only editors
data.body:
Testing #16558 

- In the git view, select a file that was removed.
- set focus to the editor and try the actions from the selection menu

  - set cursor above/below doesn't seem to have an effect
  - move/copy lines don't have an effect

- Unavailable actions should better be disabled. or maybe there should be some feed back.
- set cursor above/below should also work in a readonly editor

data.title: 'Add line comment' should be called 'Toggle line comment'
data.body:
Notice that the add line comment actually toggles the comment. Thus the naming seems to be wrong.

![screen shot 2016-12-06 at 12 12 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/20923569/4e45067e-bbad-11e6-9857-b8ba404342df.png)
